alert.note: Alert for Clark (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 7:11AM CDT until July 15 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Clark County in central Wisconsin... * Until 900 AM CDT. * At 711 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported high water still over some roads within the county. Thunderstorms that had produced the heavy rain have since moved out of the warned area, but moderate rainfall continues. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lynn, Granton, Chili Corners, Chili, Veefkind and County Roads H And K. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
